text: Robert Alan Monkhouse OBE (1 June 1928 â€“ 29 December 2003) was a British writer, actor, comedian and presenter. He was born in Beckenham, Kent. He wrote and presented on radio. He acted in films and wrote and acted on television. He was a game show host and stand-up comedian.Telegraph obituary Some of the most famous game shows he presented include The Golden Shot, Celebrity Squares, Family Fortunes, Bob's Full House and Wipeout. Monkhouse died of prostate cancer in Bedford aged 75. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1928 births Category:2003 deaths Category:British game show hosts Category:British radio personalities Category:British stand-up comedians Category:British television writers Category:Cancer deaths in England Category:Comedians from Kent Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:English movie actors Category:English television actors Category:English television presenters Category:Television personalities from Kent Category:Writers from Kent
title: Bob Monkhouse
